bug.author: Erhannis
bug.description: ModelSerializer.restoreMultiLayerNetwork(InputStream) depends on java.nio.file.Paths, which doesn't exist on Android, so it crashes there. ("Files" may also cause issues, for the same reason.) <denchmark-code>E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-21537 Process: com.aptima.android.dl4jandroidtest, PID: 32755 java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed resolution of: Ljava/nio/file/Paths; at org.deeplearning4j.util.ModelSerializer.restoreMultiLayerNetwork(ModelSerializer.java:291) at org.deeplearning4j.util.ModelSerializer.restoreMultiLayerNetwork(ModelSerializer.java:296) at com.aptima.android.dl4jandroidtest.BasicRNNExample.runModel(BasicRNNExample.java:195) at com.aptima.android.dl4jandroidtest.MainActivity$1$1.run(MainActivity.java:81) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Didn't find class comments.comment: Fix applied & merged. Thanks for highlighting this issue. Please, let us know if you'll find any more issues with Android.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
